meaningMnemonic: You already learned that 逃げる means "to escape," and this verb is when you let something escape, or slip through your fingers. So this means <vocabulary>to miss</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to lose</vocabulary> a good chance, or <vocabulary>to let go</vocabulary> of a good opportunity.
readingMnemonic:
Here's a mnemonic to remember the kun'yomi for this word:

You <vocabulary>missed</vocabulary> a huge opportunity. Why? Because there was <reading>no ga</reading>s (のが) in your car! Think about what opportunity you missed out on because you forgot to fill up your car.
